titleInfo.title: Letter No. 12 to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from John Beaumont at Bushire

physicalDescription.extent: A slim portion of text is missing on the right-hand side of Page 5.

mods.abstract: The letter reports that Ally Mahomet Kahn [Ali Mohammed Khan, the Zand Governor of Basra], in response to his defeat by Arab forces gathered a force of 8,000 men but was totally defeated by an Arab force of 12-15,000 and was killed or taken prisoner. Since their victory, the Arabs (under the leadership of Shaikh Yamar) are said to have surrounded Bussora [Basra] and stopped people entering and leaving. The letter also notes that Shaikh Nassir is leaving Bussora on pilgrimage to Mecca and at his request has been paid 4,000 rupees for 4 years rent of the factory in Bushire.A supplementary note added on 17 October 1778 informs Bombay of the arrival of the EagleSnow under command of Captain Adam Sheriff. Shipped by Shaikh Nassir's Gallivat.
